infos.info: By Hickerson, the program was known as - Kate Smith's Column 4/4/38-6/22/38 - Speaking Her Mind 10/4/38-5/27/39 and - Kate Smith's Serenade 3/22/47-7/26/47.

By Hickerson, this show was called ';Kate Smith A & P Bandwagon while sponsored by A&P.'; - During July 7, 1947 - September 9, 1949, Dunning (1998) indicates that the show during this time was broadcast at 12:15 PM or 12:45 PM.

Dunning's Encyclopedia of Old Time Radio shows the following: - 1931 NBC show: twice a week - April 26 - Sept. 12, 1931, CBS show, 15 min., Sundays at 7:45 for opening show, then 4 a week at 7:45, later 6 a week at 7:00. No other shows of this name until: - July 7, 1947-Sept.9, 1949,WOR/Mutual, 15 min., weekdays at 12:15 or 12:45 (WOR 1947-8 Mutual 1948-49 sponsored by Phillip Morris). - April 1 -Sept. 14, 1951, Mutual, 15 min., weekdays at 12:15.

Dunning's Encyclopedia of Old Time Radio shows the following: - The Kate Smith New Star Revue begins in December 1934 on CBS for the Hudson Motor Car Company, Mondays at 8:30 pm, starring Kate Smith, with Jack Miller's orchestra, the Three Ambassadors, and guests including Dizzy Dean. Continues May 30-Aug.15, 1935, Thursdays at 8, 60 min.
In his book, Music Radio, Jim Cox has the alternate title, Kate Smith Calling.
This series developed into the Kate Smith Show.

Dunning's Encyclopedia of Old Time Radio shows the following: - Sept.14, 1931 - Oct. 31, 1933, CBS, 15 min., various times usually several times a week. Sponsored by La Palina Cigars,Jack Miller, pianist.
